item.title: Learn how to avoid the pitfalls that stall startup fundraising at TechCrunch All Stage on July 15
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: There’s no shortage of capital out there, but there’s even less room for error. Join a powerhouse panel at TechCrunch All Stage on July 15 in Boston for “Fundraising Mistakes That Will Kill Your Round, and How to Avoid Them.” This Scale Stage breakout session is built specifically for early-stage founders who want to sidestep […]

item.title: PR is your scaling power: Learn from Insight Partners’ Nikki Parker at TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: PR and marketing are more than just press releases — they’re powerful tools for attracting investors, customers, and top talent.  At TechCrunch All Stage on July 15, Nikki Parker, EVP of Marketing and Communications at global software investor Insight Partners, will break down the essential PR and marketing strategies every startup needs. From crafting compelling […]

item.title: Google brings Gemini to Wear OS watches, adds AI Mode to Circle to Search
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Google is rolling out Gemini to Wear OS watches, the company announced on Wednesday.

item.title: Samsung launches Z Fold7 and Z Flip7, adds a cheaper Z Flip7 FE to its foldable lineup
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: With its new foldable lineup, Samsung's trying to attract a broader segment of users to its most significant new phone format in years.

item.title: 6 days until TechCrunch All Stage kicks off in Boston — and up to $475 in ticket savings disappear
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: In just 6 days, the doors to TechCrunch All Stage swing open in Boston’s SoWa Power Station — and your chance to save up to $475 slams shut. This isn’t just another founder event. It’s the summit designed to help startups move faster, fundraise smarter, and scale more effectively. Whether you’re refining your pitch, preparing […]

item.title: Samsung brings back the Classic version for the Watch8 series
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Samsung launched the Galaxy Watch8 smartwatch today at its Unpacked July 2025 event, along with the Galaxy Watch8 Classic version with a rotating bezel, which made a comeback after a year’s gap. Both watches have undergone a design overhaul and now resemble the Galaxy Watch Ultra, launched last year, which had a squarish case around […]

item.title: Moroccan founder raises $4.2M for her YC-backed startup building the next layer of AI search
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: ZeroEntropy is serving up retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) through an API. It's landed Initialized, a16z Scout and a long list of angels, as investors.

item.title: How to protect your cell phone number from SIM swap attacks
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: These carrier security settings can prevent your phone number from being hijacked or stolen.

item.title: Hugging Face opens up orders for its Reachy Mini desktop robots
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Hugging Face is releasing two versions of its desktop robot meant for designing and coding AI applications.

item.title: European VC breaks taboo by investing in pure defense tech from Ukraine’s war zones
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: With a fundraising target of €25 million, Darkstar’s goal is to help startups bring battle-tested products to military customers both in Ukraine and throughout Europe.

item.title: Rivian spinoff Also raises another $200M to build e-bikes and more
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Also, the micromobility startup that spun out of Rivian this year, was raised $200 million from Greenoaks Capital.

item.title: LangChain is about to become a unicorn, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: AI infrastructure startup LangChain is raising a new round at about $1 billion valuation led by IVP.

item.title: Grok is being antisemitic again and also the sky is blue
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Grok, the AI chatbot powered by Elon Musk's xAI company, is back with more antisemitic rants.

item.title: Apple COO Jeff Williams to step down later this month
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Having worked at Apple for nearly three decades, Williams has played a significant role in introducing the iPod and iPhone programs, leading the development of the Apple Watch, and overseeing the design team, among other contributions.

item.title: US government confirms arrest of Chinese national accused of stealing COVID research and mass-hacking email servers
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Accused hacker and Chinese national Xu Zewei was arrested in Italy at the request of U.S. prosecutors.

item.title: GenAI as a shopping assistant set to explode during Prime Day sales
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Amazon's annual sale is predicted to drive $23.8 billion in online spending across U.S. e-commerce retailers, as other businesses run their own competing sales alongside the popular shopping event.

item.title: SpaceX in talks to raise new funding at $400B valuation
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: The company’s strategy is to raise money via a fundraising round and separately hold a tender offer to allow employees to sell some of their shares to a select group of investors.

item.title: Mistral is reportedly in talks to raise $1B
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: French AI startup Mistral is in talks to raise up to $1 billion in equity from investors including Abu Dhabi’s MGX fund, reports Bloomberg.

item.title: Activision took down Call of Duty game after PC players hacked, says source
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Activision last week brought offline the Microsoft Store version of Call of Duty: WWII as the company was investigating “reports of an issue.”

item.title: Gmail’s new ‘Manage subscriptions’ tool will help declutter your inbox
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Google announced on Tuesday that it's launching a new Gmail feature that is designed to help users easily manage their subscriptions and declutter their inbox.
